result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy A. Zarm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Send Obscene Email Messages, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.25(2).
  • Send Obscene Email Messages, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.25(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:55 p.m. Defendant Roy A. Zarm in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in receipt of and has reviewed psycho-sexual evaluation. State moves to amend Count 1 to a violation of 944.25(2)-Send Obscene Email - a Class A Misdemeanor and to add Count 2 - a violation of 944.25(2) - Send Obscene Email - Class A Misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest pleas to both Counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Ferguson/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Court receives evaluation as Exhibit and orders sealed. Report may be released to probation agent for tailoring probation counseling/conditions,
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years each count concurrent
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 40 days with Huber for all purposes to commence on/before April 1, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Jail credit - 1 day
Participate in counseling consistent with evaluation.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan given.
Adj. 2:36 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:39 p.m. Defendant Roy A. Zarm in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig requests new date. Bail continued. Adj. 3:42 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.

3:47. Defendant Roy A. Zarm in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint/information - waives reading - enters not guilty plea. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm. 03:49 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

3:04 p.m. Defendant Roy A. Zarm in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bail continued. Adj. 3:07 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

02:58 pm - Defendant Roy A. Zarm in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

May not use any type of electronic device that has internet access, including computer, cell phone, i-pod, etc.  May not have any unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18.  May use a computer while at work for work purposes only.

01:48 pm - Defendant Roy A. Zarm in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel.  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
